summary: This document is an email chain from October 15, 2020, discussing the process of running search terms to identify responsive versus junk documents in the case 'US v. Epstein'. The correspondence involves logistical coordination for document review and tagging in relation to a search warrant (SW).

events.title: Document Search Coordination for US v. Epstein
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the execution and review of search terms ('Epstein — Junk Search Terms (From)' and 'Epstein — Junk Search Terms (Keywords)') to tag documents as junk or responsive in the case US v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain about managing document discovery in the case 'US v. Epstein'.
It references specific search strategies: 'Epstein — Junk Search Terms (From)' to be tagged as junk, and a separate keyword search that caught non-junk documents.
The correspondence indicates a review process for documents collected under a search warrant (SW).
The emails are focused on the technical and procedural aspects of filtering a document database for case relevance.
